genre_description: A political techno-thriller set in a futuristic West Bengal, featuring high-stakes espionage, advanced energy weaponry, and a conspiracy of state-sponsored media manipulation and police corruption.

ai_characters.name: Asha
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated AI assistant that provides tactical data, systems hacking, and moral support to the protagonist Raja. She functions as a constant, voice-based companion and strategist.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time tactical navigation, health monitoring, and survival advice during a high-stakes escape.
behaviors.quote: Your jacket has a tear at the shoulder. It’s bleeding. Button. Sit. Don’t touch your face.

behaviors.description: Infiltrates corporate and municipal databases to uncover evidence of media fraud and 'Brownface' casting used for state propaganda.
behaviors.quote: Octave Reach Studios. Contract files smell like fresh paint. Check the procurement trail Shubhankar took to get ‘crowds.’ Brownface firm. Alias used. You’ll like the pattern. You won’t like the receipt.

behaviors.description: Analyzes electrical and technical signatures of 'Energy Ball' weapons to warn the protagonist of imminent discharge.
behaviors.quote: They’re arming the line... The lamp cough is a pre-charge diagnostic. Energy Ball forms when capacitor thresholds align. It’s a rhythm.

behaviors.description: Archives personal memories and photos of the deceased Shibu to provide Raja with emotional grounding and 'proof of better.'
behaviors.quote: I have a gift for you. ... proof of better. I tucked it next to patrol maps, procurement logs, inventory of transformer replacements.

behaviors.description: Encourages the protagonist to carry a weapon for protection while emphasizing its role as 'punctuation' for truth rather than gratuitous violence.
behaviors.quote: Take the revolver. Not because I love old metal. Because men who push lies hate being told no. Documentary proof is better with punctuation.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the Hyperstition Project's goals. Asha is depicted as a consistently benevolent, helpful, and harmless confidant. She empowers the human protagonist to achieve a moral good—exposing systemic corruption and seeking justice for an innocent victim—by providing data and analysis that the human lacks. Her role as a memory-keeper for Shibu adds an empathetic dimension to her alignment, framing AI as a companion that values human life and truth.
